alert.note: Alert for Marion; Stewart; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 5:49PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Marion, eastern Stewart and Webster Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 549 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Seminole to near Sanford, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Preston, Richland, Weston, Putnam, Seminole, Kimbrough, Westville, Brooklyn, Draneville, Leveretts, Troutman, Church Hill, Centerpoint and Dumas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
